3. TCMs As Convolutions#

This module contains a collection of functions to compute Time-Activity Curves (TACs) for common Tissue Compartment Models (TCMs). These models are commonly used for kinetic analysis of PET TACs.

Note

All response functions in this module are decorated with numba.jit. It compiles the function to machine code at runtime (Just-In-Time compilation), which usually provides a significant speed-up.

Requires:

The module relies on the numpy and numba modules.

Todo

Add the derivations of the solutions to the Tissue Compartment Models in the module docstring.

calc_convolution_with_check(f: ndarray, g: ndarray, dt: float) → ndarray#

Performs a discrete convolution of two arrays, assumed to represent time-series data. Checks if the arrays are of the same shape.

Let f\(=f(t)\) and g\(=g(t)\) where both functions are 0 for \(t\leq0\). Then, the output, \(h(t)\), is

\[h(t) = \int_{0}^{t}f(s)g(s-t)\mathrm{d}s\]
Parameters:

  • f (np.ndarray) -- Array containing the values for the input function.

  • g (np.ndarray) -- Array containing values for the response function.

  • dt (np.ndarray) -- The step-size, in the time-domain, between samples for f and g.

Returns:

Convolution of the two arrays scaled by dt.

Return type:

(np.ndarray)

Important

This function does not use numba.jit. Therefore, it cannot be used directly inside JIT'ed functions.

response_function_1tcm_c1(t: ndarray, k1: float, k2: float) → ndarray#

The response function for the 1TCM \(f(t)=k_1 e^{-k_{2}t}\)

Parameters:

  • t (np.ndarray) -- Array containing time-points where \(t\geq0\).

  • k1 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from plasma/blood to tissue compartment.

  • k2 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from tissue compartment back to plasma/blood.

Returns:

Array containing response function values given the constants.

Return type:

(np.ndarray)

response_function_2tcm_with_k4zero_c1(t: ndarray, k1: float, k2: float, k3: float) → ndarray#

The response function for first compartment in the serial 2TCM with \(k_{4}=0\); \(f(t)=k_{1}e^{-(k_{2} + k_{3})t}\).

Parameters:

  • t (np.ndarray) -- Array containing time-points where \(t\geq0\).

  • k1 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from plasma/blood to tissue compartment.

  • k2 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from tissue compartment back to plasma/blood.

  • k3 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from tissue compartment to irreversible compartment.

Returns:

Array containing response function values for first compartment given the constants.

Return type:

(np.ndarray)

See also

response_function_2tcm_with_k4zero_c2

response_function_2tcm_with_k4zero_c2(t: ndarray, k1: float, k2: float, k3: float) → ndarray#

The response function for second compartment in the serial 2TCM with \(k_{4}=0\); \(f(t)=\frac{k_{1}k_{3}}{k_{2}+k_{3}}(1-e^{-(k_{2} + k_{3})t})\).

Parameters:

  • t (np.ndarray) -- Array containing time-points where \(t\geq0\).

  • k1 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from plasma/blood to tissue compartment.

  • k2 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from tissue compartment back to plasma/blood.

  • k3 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from tissue compartment to irreversible compartment.

Returns:

Array containing response function values for first compartment given the constants.

Return type:

(np.ndarray)

See also

response_function_2tcm_with_k4zero_c1

response_function_serial_2tcm_c1(t: ndarray, k1: float, k2: float, k3: float, k4: float) → ndarray#

The response function for first compartment in the serial 2TCM.

\[f(t) = \frac{k_{1}}{a} \left[ (k_{4}-\alpha_{1})e^{-\alpha_{1}t} + (\alpha_{2}-k_{4})e^{-\alpha_{2}t}\right]\]

where

\[\begin{split}a&= k_{2}+k_{3}+k_{4}\\ \alpha_{1}&=\frac{a-\sqrt{a^{2}-4k_{2}k_{4}}}{2}\\ \alpha_{1}&=\frac{a+\sqrt{a^{2}-4k_{2}k_{4}}}{2}\end{split}\]
Parameters:

  • t (np.ndarray) -- Array containing time-points where \(t\geq0\).

  • k1 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from plasma/blood to tissue compartment.

  • k2 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from first tissue compartment back to plasma/blood.

  • k3 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from first tissue compartment to second tissue compartment.

  • k4 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from second tissue compartment back to first tissue compartment.

Returns:

Array containing response function values for first compartment given the constants.

Return type:

(np.ndarray)

See also

  • response_function_serial_2tcm_c2

  • response_function_2tcm_with_k4zero_c1 for when \(k_{4}=0\) (irreversible second compartment).

response_function_serial_2tcm_c2(t: ndarray, k1: float, k2: float, k3: float, k4: float) → ndarray#

The response function for second compartment in the serial 2TCM.

\[f(t) = \frac{k_{1}k_{3}}{a} \left[ e^{-\alpha_{1}t} - e^{-\alpha_{2}t}\right]\]

where

\[\begin{split}a&= k_{2}+k_{3}+k_{4}\\ \alpha_{1}&=\frac{a-\sqrt{a^{2}-4k_{2}k_{4}}}{2}\\ \alpha_{1}&=\frac{a+\sqrt{a^{2}-4k_{2}k_{4}}}{2}\end{split}\]
Parameters:

  • t (np.ndarray) -- Array containing time-points where \(t\geq0\).

  • k1 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from plasma/blood to tissue compartment.

  • k2 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from first tissue compartment back to plasma/blood.

  • k3 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from first tissue compartment to second tissue compartment.

  • k4 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from second tissue compartment back to first tissue compartment.

Returns:

Array containing response function values for second compartment given the constants.

Return type:

(np.ndarray)

See also

  • response_function_serial_2tcm_c2

  • response_function_2tcm_with_k4zero_c2 for when \(k_{4}=0\) (irreversible second compartment).

generate_tac_1tcm_c1_from_tac(tac_times: ndarray, tac_vals: ndarray, k1: float, k2: float) → ndarray#

Calculate the TTAC, given the input TAC, for a 1TCM as an explicit convolution.

Parameters:

  • tac_times (np.ndarray) -- Array containing time-points where \(t\geq0\) and equal time-steps.

  • tac_vals (np.ndarray) -- Array containing TAC activities.

  • k1 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from plasma/blood to tissue compartment.

  • k2 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from first tissue compartment back to plasma/blood.

Returns:

Arrays containing the times and TTAC given the input TAC and parameters.

Return type:

((np.ndarray, np.ndarray))

See also

response_function_1tcm_c1 for more details about the 1TCM response function used for the convolution.

generate_tac_2tcm_with_k4zero_c1_from_tac(tac_times: ndarray, tac_vals: ndarray, k1: float, k2: float, k3: float) → ndarray#

Calculate the TTAC of the first comparment, given the input TAC, for a 2TCM (with \(k_{4}=0\)) as an explicit convolution.

Parameters:

  • tac_times (np.ndarray) -- Array containing time-points where \(t\geq0\) and equal time-steps.

  • tac_vals (np.ndarray) -- Array containing TAC activities.

  • k1 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from plasma/blood to tissue compartment.

  • k2 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from first tissue compartment back to plasma/blood.

  • k3 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from tissue compartment to irreversible compartment.

Returns:

Arrays containing the times and TTAC given the input TAC and parameters.

Return type:

((np.ndarray, np.ndarray))

See also

response_function_2tcm_with_k4zero_c1 for more details about the 2TCM response function, of the first compartment, used for the convolution.

generate_tac_2tcm_with_k4zero_c2_from_tac(tac_times: ndarray, tac_vals: ndarray, k1: float, k2: float, k3: float) → ndarray#

Calculate the TTAC of the second comparment, given the input TAC, for a 2TCM (with \(k_{4}=0\)) as an explicit convolution.

Parameters:

  • tac_times (np.ndarray) -- Array containing time-points where \(t\geq0\) and equal time-steps.

  • tac_vals (np.ndarray) -- Array containing TAC activities.

  • k1 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from plasma/blood to tissue compartment.

  • k2 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from first tissue compartment back to plasma/blood.

  • k3 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from tissue compartment to irreversible compartment.

Returns:

Arrays containing the times and TTAC given the input TAC and parameters.

Return type:

((np.ndarray, np.ndarray))

See also

response_function_2tcm_with_k4zero_c2 for more details about the 2TCM response function, of the second compartment, used for the convolution.

generate_tac_2tcm_with_k4zero_cpet_from_tac(tac_times: ndarray, tac_vals: ndarray, k1: float, k2: float, k3: float) → ndarray#

Calculate the PET-TTAC (sum of both compartments), given the input TAC, for a 2TCM (with \(k_{4}=0\)) as an explicit convolution.

Parameters:

  • tac_times (np.ndarray) -- Array containing time-points where \(t\geq0\) and equal time-steps.

  • tac_vals (np.ndarray) -- Array containing TAC activities.

  • k1 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from plasma/blood to tissue compartment.

  • k2 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from first tissue compartment back to plasma/blood.

  • k3 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from tissue compartment to irreversible compartment.

Returns:

Arrays containing the times and TTAC given the input TAC and parameters.

Return type:

((np.ndarray, np.ndarray))

See also

  • response_function_2tcm_with_k4zero_c1 for more details about the 2TCM response function, of the first compartment, used for the convolution.

  • response_function_2tcm_with_k4zero_c2 for more details about the 2TCM response function, of the second compartment, used for the convolution.

generate_tac_serial_2tcm_c1_from_tac(tac_times: ndarray, tac_vals: ndarray, k1: float, k2: float, k3: float, k4: float) → ndarray#

Calculate the TTAC of the first comparment, given the input TAC, for a serial 2TCM as an explicit convolution.

Parameters:

  • tac_times (np.ndarray) -- Array containing time-points where \(t\geq0\) and equal time-steps.

  • tac_vals (np.ndarray) -- Array containing TAC activities.

  • k1 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from plasma/blood to tissue compartment.

  • k2 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from first tissue compartment back to plasma/blood.

  • k3 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from tissue compartment to second compartment.

  • k4 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from second tissue compartment back to first tissue compartment.

Returns:

Arrays containing the times and TTAC given the input TAC and parameters.

Return type:

((np.ndarray, np.ndarray))

See also

  • response_function_serial_2tcm_c1 for more details about the 2TCM response function, of the first compartment, used for the convolution.

  • response_function_2tcm_with_k4zero_c1 for more details about the 2TCM response function (with \(k_{4}=0\)), of the first compartment, used for the convolution.

generate_tac_serial_2tcm_c2_from_tac(tac_times: ndarray, tac_vals: ndarray, k1: float, k2: float, k3: float, k4: float) → ndarray#

Calculate the TTAC of the second comparment, given the input TAC, for a serial 2TCM as an explicit convolution.

Parameters:

  • tac_times (np.ndarray) -- Array containing time-points where \(t\geq0\) and equal time-steps.

  • tac_vals (np.ndarray) -- Array containing TAC activities.

  • k1 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from plasma/blood to tissue compartment.

  • k2 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from first tissue compartment back to plasma/blood.

  • k3 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from tissue compartment to second compartment.

  • k4 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from second tissue compartment back to first tissue compartment.

Returns:

Arrays containing the times and TTAC given the input TAC and parameters.

Return type:

((np.ndarray, np.ndarray))

See also

  • response_function_serial_2tcm_c2 for more details about the 2TCM response function, of the second compartment, used for the convolution.

  • response_function_2tcm_with_k4zero_c2 for more details about the 2TCM response function (with \(k_{4}=0\)), of the second compartment, used for the convolution.

generate_tac_serial_2tcm_cpet_from_tac(tac_times: ndarray, tac_vals: ndarray, k1: float, k2: float, k3: float, k4: float) → ndarray#

Calculate the PET-TTAC (sum of both compartments), given the input TAC, for a serial 2TCM as an explicit convolution.

Parameters:

  • tac_times (np.ndarray) -- Array containing time-points where \(t\geq0\) and equal time-steps.

  • tac_vals (np.ndarray) -- Array containing TAC activities.

  • k1 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from plasma/blood to tissue compartment.

  • k2 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from first tissue compartment back to plasma/blood.

  • k3 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from tissue compartment to second compartment.

  • k4 (float) -- Rate constant for transport from second tissue compartment back to first tissue compartment.

Returns:

Arrays containing the times and TTAC given the input TAC and parameters.

Return type:

((np.ndarray, np.ndarray))

See also

  • response_function_serial_2tcm_c1 for more details about the 2TCM response function, of the first

    compartment, used for the convolution.

  • response_function_2tcm_with_k4zero_c1 for more details about the 2TCM response function

    (with \(k_{4}=0\)), of the first compartment, used for the convolution.

  • response_function_serial_2tcm_c2 for more details about the 2TCM response function, of the second

    compartment, used for the convolution.

  • response_function_2tcm_with_k4zero_c2 for more details about the 2TCM response function

    (with \(k_{4}=0\)), of the second compartment, used for the convolution.
